channel.title: For those who like classical music
channel.description:
Until the 24th of november, a Dutch radio station offers 10 free downloadable symphonies (listed below). But why download it here while you can just use torrents/*wire/newsservers/etc? Well, most symphony's are quite long, and are about 100mb large, so 10x100mb is 1Gb. So this is faster! Just sign up here: http://kco.radio4.nl/?page=register&lang=en and enjoy quality!
Franz Schubert - Symfonie no. 8 'Unvollendete' Ludwig van Beethoven - Symfonie no. 2 Felix Mendelssohn - Symfonie no. 4 'Italiaanse' César Franck - Symfonie in d Gustav Mahler - Symfonie no. 1 Antonin Dvorák - Symfonie no. 8 Camille Saint-Saëns - Symfonie no. 3 'Orgelsymfonie' Jean Sibelius - Symfonie no. 2 Anton Bruckner - Symfonie no. 8 Johannes Brahms - Symfonie no. 2
Edit: They did add a small ad at the end of every song :(

item.title: For those who like classical music
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Like half or less of that is classical, but not a bad selection for phree nonetheless.

Read full topic
item.source: For those who like classical music

item.title: For those who like classical music
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

Thanks.

Stravinsky is awesome. When the “Rite of Spring” was first preformed it started a riot! Right now I’m downloading “The Planets Suite” by Gustav Holst. Lately I’ve been listening to Mozart, Schubert, and Schoenberg. Schoenberg is crazy! His music goes in unexpected dimensions and directions.

Read full topic
item.source: For those who like classical music

item.title: For those who like classical music
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

I’ve been listening to Antonin Dvorák - Symfonie no. 8 the past 2 hours, as it’s a song of about 40 minutes. And I really like it.

Read full topic

item.title: For those who like classical music
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

I already have everything with Brahms, Schubert and Beethoven. It’s good music. Try Igor Stavinsky, his music is really awesome.

Read full topic

item.title: For those who like classical music
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Until the 24th of november, a Dutch radio station offers 10 free downloadable symphonies (listed below). But why download it here while you can just use torrents/*wire/newsservers/etc? Well, most symphony’s are quite long, and are about 100mb large, so 10x100mb is 1Gb. So this is faster! Just sign up here: http://kco.radio4.nl/?page=register&lang=en and enjoy quality!

Franz Schubert - Symfonie no. 8 ‘Unvollendete’
Ludwig van Beethoven - Symfonie no. 2
Felix Mendelssohn - Symfonie no. 4 ‘Italiaanse’
César Franck - Symfonie in d
Gustav Mahler - Symfonie no. 1
Antonin Dvorák - Symfonie no. 8
Camille Saint-Saëns - Symfonie no. 3 ‘Orgelsymfonie’
Jean Sibelius - Symfonie no. 2
Anton Bruckner - Symfonie no. 8
Johannes Brahms - Symfonie no. 2

Edit: They did add a small ad at the end of every song
